DataElement.preferredName: Patient Advanced Malignant Neoplasm Prior Registration Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether advanced cancer, a term for diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control reproduction, status of a patient or participant prior to registration or enrollment on a clinical trial as a medical and/or social characteristic prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Advanced Malignant Neoplasm Prior Registration Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the advanced cancer, a term for diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control reproduction, status of a patient or participant prior to registration or enrollment on a clinical trial as an eligibility criterion for participation on a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Advanced Malignant Neoplasm Prior Registration Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Far along in course.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Earlier in time or order.:Registration; the act of enrolling.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Stage III or IV invasive canc
ReferenceDocuments.description: Stage III or IV invasive cancer, besides breast cancer, in <=5 years prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Pre-registration EUS, CT of chest and upper abdomen, and PET must support a clinical stage of T3N0M0, T2-3N1M0 or T2-3N0-1M1a (celiac adenopathy must be <=2 cm by EUS)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient, as documented by the treating physician, is clinically staged as one of the following T4 a-c for whom modified radical mastectomy with negative margins is the goal, T2 or T3 for whom conversion from needing mastectomy to breast conservation is the goal, T2 for whom lumpectomy at first attempt is the goal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Stage III or IV invasive cancer, other than breast cancer, in <=5 years prior to registration.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have pT2 - pT4 tumors including inflammatory breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a pT1mi or pT2 - pT4 tumor including inflammatory breast cancer?
